canonical_explanation.text: Area theorems establish fundamental relationships between areas of geometric figures. Key theorems include: (1) Parallelograms on the same base and between the same parallel lines have equal areas; (2) The area of a triangle is half the area of a parallelogram on the same base and between the same parallel lines; (3) Triangles on the same base and between the same parallel lines have equal areas. These theorems are essential for solving complex geometric problems involving area calculations and proofs.
rules: Parallelograms with the same base and between the same parallel lines are equal in area
A triangle's area is half that of a parallelogram on the same base and between the same parallels
Triangles on the same base and between the same parallel lines have equal areas
The distance between parallel lines represents the height of the figure
Congruent figures have equal areas, but figures with equal areas need not be congruent

options.text: Area of ABCD = Area of ABEF
Area of ABCD > Area of ABEF
Area of ABCD < Area of ABEF

questions.question_text: Two parallelograms ABCD and ABEF are on the same base AB and between the same parallel lines AB and CF. What can be concluded about their areas?
If the area of parallelogram PQRS is 60 cm², what is the area of triangle PQR on the same base PQ and between the same parallel lines?
Two triangles ABC and DBC are on the same base BC and between the same parallel lines. Which statement is true?
Parallelograms on the same base and between the same parallel lines are always congruent.
The area of a triangle is half the area of a parallelogram on the same base and between the same parallel lines.
Two triangles on the same base and between the same parallel lines must have the same shape.
Parallelograms on the same base and between the same _______ have equal areas.
If a parallelogram has an area of 48 cm², then a triangle on the same base and between the same parallels has an area of _______ cm².
The essential condition for two triangles to have equal areas using area theorems is that they lie on the same base and between the same _______.

ordering_items: Apply area formula: Area = base × height for both
Recognize that DC and EF lie on the same parallel line to AB
Consider two parallelograms ABCD and ABEF on base AB
Consider two parallelograms ABCD and ABEF on base AB
Conclude that both parallelograms have the same height
Identify that AB || DC and AB || EF
correct_answer: Consider two parallelograms ABCD and ABEF on base AB
Consider two parallelograms ABCD and ABEF on base AB
Identify that AB || DC and AB || EF
Recognize that DC and EF lie on the same parallel line to AB
Conclude that both parallelograms have the same height
Apply area formula: Area = base × height for both
questions.question_text: Arrange the steps to prove that parallelograms on the same base and between the same parallel lines have equal areas:
Parallelogram ABCD has base 8 cm and height 5 cm. Another parallelogram ABEF is on the same base AB and between the same parallels. What is the area of ABEF?
Triangle ABC has base BC = 12 cm and height 7 cm. If a parallelogram BCDE is constructed on the same base BC and between the same parallels, what is its area?
Triangle PQR has an area of 36 cm². Another triangle STR is on the same base QR and between the same parallel lines. What is the area of triangle STR?
In a parallelogram ABCD, point E lies on CD. If the area of triangle ABE is 45 cm², what is the area of parallelogram ABCD?
If two parallelograms have equal areas, they must be on the same base and between the same parallel lines.
A triangle and a parallelogram on the same base and between the same parallels can have equal areas if the parallelogram is half the size.
If triangle ABC and triangle DBC have equal areas and share base BC, then A and D must lie on a line parallel to BC.
If parallelogram PQRS has area 96 cm² and triangle PQT is on the same base PQ with half the height of the parallelogram, then the area of triangle PQT is _______ cm².
Two parallelograms on the same base of 10 cm are between parallel lines 6 cm apart. Each parallelogram has an area of _______ cm².
If the area of triangle XYZ is 54 cm², then the area of a parallelogram on the same base and between the same parallel lines is _______ cm².

Apply the theorem: triangle area = half parallelogram area
Note the triangle shares the same base

Confirm the triangle is between the same parallel lines
Calculate: divide parallelogram area by 2

Apply the theorem: triangle area = half parallelogram area
Calculate: divide parallelogram area by 2

ABCD is a parallelogram with area 120 cm². Point P is on AB. If triangle PCD has area x cm², what is x?

options.text: Area of EBD = Area of FDC
Area of EBD > Area of FDC
Area of EBD < Area of FDC

questions.question_text: In triangle ABC, D is the midpoint of BC. Points E and F are on AB and AC respectively such that EF || BC. If area of triangle ABC is 80 cm², what is the relationship between areas of triangles EBD and FDC?

options.text: Triangles on the same base and between the same parallels are equal in area
Triangle area equals half the parallelogram area on same base between same parallels
Parallelograms on the same base and between the same parallels are equal in area

questions.question_text: ABCD is a parallelogram. P and Q are points on AB and DC respectively such that AP = CQ. Prove that the area of quadrilateral APCQ equals half the area of parallelogram ABCD. Which theorem is essential for this proof?

Two parallelograms ABCD and ABEF are on the same base AB. If DC and EF are on the same line parallel to AB, and AB = 15 cm with perpendicular distance between parallels = 8 cm, find the sum of their areas.
In parallelogram PQRS, T is a point on QR. If the area of triangle PST is 56 cm² and the area of triangle PQT is 32 cm², what is the area of parallelogram PQRS?
ABC is a triangle with D, E, F as midpoints of BC, CA, AB respectively. If area of triangle ABC is 96 cm², what is the area of triangle DEF?
ABCD is a parallelogram with area 180 cm². Points P and Q are on sides AD and BC respectively such that AP:PD = 2:3 and BQ:QC = 2:3. What is the area of quadrilateral ABQP?
If three parallelograms share the same base and all lie between the same pair of parallel lines, then all three have equal areas.
If the diagonal of a parallelogram divides it into two triangles, each triangle has an area equal to one-quarter of a parallelogram on the same base and between the same parallels.
If ABCD is a parallelogram and P is any point on CD, then the area of triangle ABP equals the area of triangle ABC.

PQRS is a parallelogram with area 144 cm². If T is a point inside the parallelogram such that triangles PQT and RST have equal areas of 36 cm² each, then the sum of areas of triangles PST and QRT is _______ cm².
If parallelogram ABCD has base 18 cm and parallelogram ABEF on the same base has area 126 cm², then the perpendicular distance between the parallel lines is _______ cm.
In a parallelogram WXYZ with area 200 cm², the diagonal WY divides it into two triangles. The area of each triangle is _______ cm².

ABCD is a rectangle with AB = 12 cm and BC = 8 cm. Point P is on AB such that AP = 5 cm. What is the area of triangle DPC?
Three parallelograms ABCD, ABEF, and ABGH all share the same base AB = 14 cm and lie between parallel lines 9 cm apart. The total area of all three parallelograms is _______ cm².
